item.description:
Get ready for that big Xmas dinner by taking a hike on Xmas Eve Day

Mt. Crawford has a bare summit but offers protected hiking trails most of the way. The final section may be icey and exposed to high winds. There are a few look outs along the way. On a clear day this 3K peak offers views that rival many 4K peaks.

We will follow the Davis Path from the parking area on Rte 302 to the Mt Crawford Spur trail, then to the summit.

Please check your maps and AMC White Mountain Guide for a description of the trail.

Dogs are Welcome!

Distance - @ 5.0 miles,
Elevation Gain - @2,100 feet
Book Time @ 4:30 excluding stops
Goal time 4:30 including stops

Please arrive in enough time so that you are ready to hit the trail at 10 AM sharp.

We will hike at or slightly faster than booktime with limited short stops in order to stay warm. Plan on food/snacks that you can eat while moving.

Be prepared for full Winter conditions - snowshoes, crampons, microspikes, goggles, extra gloves/clothes may all be needed - plan your hike accordingly based on your experiences.

If you have any questions on equipement or the hike please ask before showing up for the hike.

Directions to the trailhead: The trail starts on Route 302 at a parking area on the West side of the Saco River near the Notchland Inn, @ 5.6 miles south of the Wiley House in Crawford Notch.
